description: All tables related to Network Watcher - Traffic Analytics

tables.name: NTANetAnalytics
tables.description: Traffic Analytics records for Flowlog enriched data.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the data gets ingested into the log analytics workspace.

columns.name: SubType
columns.description: Subtype of the ingestion. Values can be Flowlog and StatusMessage.

columns.name: FaSchemaVersion
columns.description: Schema version for ingestion.

columns.name: TimeProcessed
columns.description: Time(in UTC) at which the traffic analytics processed the raw flow logs from the storage account.

columns.name: FlowIntervalStartTime
columns.description: Starting time(in UTC) of the flow log processing interval. This is time from which flow interval is measured.

columns.name: FlowIntervalEndTime
columns.description: Ending time(in UTC) of the flow log processing interval.

columns.name: FlowType
columns.description: Category of the flows(allowed values are IntraVNet, InterVNet, S2S, P2S, AzurePublic, ExternalPublic, MaliciousFlow, Unknown Private, Unknown) based on IP addresses involved in flow.

columns.name: FlowStartTime
columns.description: First occurrence of the flow (which will get aggregated) in the flow log processing interval between "FlowIntervalStartTime_t" and "FlowIntervalEndTime_t".

columns.name: FlowEndTime
columns.description: Last occurrence of the flow (which will get aggregated) in the flow log processing interval between "FlowIntervalStartTime_t" and "FlowIntervalEndTime_t". In terms of flow log v2, this field contains the time when the last flow with the same four-tuple started (marked as "B" in the raw flow record).

columns.name: SrcIp
columns.description: Source IP address.

columns.name: DestIp
columns.description: Destination IP address.
Pipe Separated Source Ports.

columns.name: DestPort
columns.description: Destination port.

columns.name: L4Protocol
columns.description: Transport Protocol,T = TCP, U = UDP.

columns.name: L7Protocol
columns.description: Application Layer protocol name.

columns.name: IsFlowCapturedAtUdrHop
columns.description: True if flow gets captured at a UDR hop.

columns.name: FlowDirection
columns.description: Direction of the flow which can be inbound or outbound.

columns.name: FlowStatus
columns.description: Status of flow which can be allowed or denied.

columns.name: NsgList
columns.description: Network Security Group(NSG) associated with the flow. This is a placeholder for NSG flow logging.

columns.name: NsgRule
columns.description: NSG rule that allowed or denied this flow. This is a placeholder for NSG flow logging.

columns.name: NsgRuleType
columns.description: The type of Network Security Group(NSG) rule used by the flow. This is a placeholder for NSG flow logging.

columns.name: MacAddress
columns.description: MAC address of the network interface at which the flow was captured.

columns.name: TargetResourceId
columns.description: Target Resource Id for the resource where flow logging has been enabled.

columns.name: TargetResourceType
columns.description: Target Resource Type where flow logging is enabled. It can be virtual network(VNET)/subnet(SUBNET)/network interface(NIC).

columns.name: FlowLogResourceId
columns.description: The resource Id for the flow log

columns.name: SrcSubscription
columns.description: Subscription of the Azure virtual network/ network interface/ virtual machine to which the source IP in the flow belongs to.

columns.name: DestSubscription
columns.description: Subscription Id of virtual network/ network interface/ virtual machine to which the destination IP in the flow belongs to.

columns.name: SrcRegion
columns.description: Azure region of virtual network/ network interface/ virtual machine to which the source IP in the flow belongs to.

columns.name: DestRegion
columns.description: Azure region of virtual network/ network interface/ virtual machine to which the destination IP in the flow belongs to.

columns.name: SrcNic
columns.description: NIC associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestNic
columns.description: NIC associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcVm
columns.description: Virtual machine associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestVm
columns.description: Virtual machine associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcSubnet
columns.description: Subnet associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestSubnet
columns.description: Subnet associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcApplicationGateway
columns.description: Application gateway associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestApplicationGateway
columns.description: Application gateway associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcLoadBalancer
columns.description: Load balancer associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestLoadBalancer
columns.description: Load balancer associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcLocalNetworkGateway
columns.description: Local network gateway associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestLocalNetworkGateway
columns.description: Local network gateway associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcExpressRouteCircuit
columns.description: Express route circuit associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestExpressRouteCircuit
columns.description: Express route circuit associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: ExpressRouteCircuitPeeringType
columns.description: The peering type of the associated express route circuit for the flow.

columns.name: ConnectionType
columns.description: Type of the connection. Possible values are VNetPeering, VpnGateway, and ExpressRoute.

columns.name: ConnectionName
columns.description: Connection Name.

columns.name: ConnectingVnets
columns.description: Space separated list of virtual network names.

columns.name: Country
columns.description: Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

columns.name: AzureRegion
columns.description: Azure region locations.

columns.name: FlowEncryption
columns.description: The type of flow encryption.

columns.name: AllowedInFlows
columns.description: Count of inbound flows that were allowed. This represents the number of flows that shared the same four-tuple inbound to the network interface at which the flow was captured.

columns.name: DeniedInFlows
columns.description: Count of inbound flows that were denied(Inbound to the network interface at which the flow was captured).

columns.name: AllowedOutFlows
columns.description: Count of outbound flows that were allowed(Outbound to the network interface at which the flow was captured).

columns.name: DeniedOutFlows
columns.description: Count of outbound flows that were denied(Outbound to the network interface at which the flow was captured).

columns.name: PacketsDestToSrc
columns.description: Represents packets sent from the destination to the source of the flow.

columns.name: PacketsSrcToDest
columns.description: Represents packets sent from the source to the destination of the flow.

columns.name: BytesDestToSrc
columns.description: Represents bytes sent from the destination to the source of the flow.

columns.name: BytesSrcToDest
columns.description: Represents bytes sent from the source to the destination of the flow.

columns.name: CompletedFlows
columns.description: This is populated with non-zero value when a flow gets a Completed event.

columns.name: SrcPublicIps
columns.description: Source public IP addresses flow information.

columns.name: DestPublicIps
columns.description: Destination public IP addresses flow information.

columns.name: AclGroup
columns.description: Access control list group refers to the network security group associated with the network security group rule name (or) the network group associated with the security admin configuration which allowed or denied the connection.

columns.name: AclRule
columns.description: Access control list rule refers to the network security group rule name or the security admin rule name which allowed or denied the connection.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Status of the ingestion. Possible values can be Completed, Partial or Failed.

columns.name: PrivateEndpointResourceId
columns.description: Resource ID of the private endpoint resource.

columns.name: PrivateLinkResourceId
columns.description: Resource ID of the private link service.

columns.name: PrivateLinkResourceName
columns.description: Resource name of the private link service.

columns.name: SrcServiceId
columns.description: Service ID associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestServiceId
columns.description: Service ID associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcServiceName
columns.description: Service Name associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestServiceName
columns.description: Service Name associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcTenantId
columns.description: Tenant ID associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestTenantId
columns.description: Tenant ID associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcTenantName
columns.description: Tenant Name associated with the source IP in the flow.

columns.name: DestTenantName
columns.description: Tenant Name associated with the destination IP in the flow.

columns.name: SrcEnvironment
columns.description: Environment associated with the source IP in the flow. Possible values can be Prod and NonProd.

columns.name: DestEnvironment
columns.description: Environment associated with the destination IP in the flow. Possible values can be Prod and NonProd.

columns.name: SrcCloud
columns.description: Cloud associated with the source IP in the flow. Possible values can be Public, Mooncake and Fairfax.

columns.name: DestCloud
columns.description: Cloud associated with the source IP in the flow. Possible values can be Public, Mooncake and Fairfax.

columns.name: SrcNetworkGroups
columns.description: In case source is tagged with a vnet, this is networkgroups that vnet belongs to.

columns.name: DestNetworkGroups
columns.description: In case destination is tagged with a vnet, this is networkgroups that vnet belongs to.

columns.name: SrcServiceTags
columns.description: Service tag of SrcPublicIps in format <Space separated list of source public ips grouped by service tag>|<ServiceTag>

columns.name: DestServiceTags
columns.description: Service tag of DestPublicIps in format <Space separated list of destination public ips grouped by service tag>|<ServiceTag>

tables.name: NTATopologyDetails
tables.description: Traffic Analytics records for Topology data.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the data gets ingested into the log analytics workspace.

columns.name: SubType
columns.description: Subtype of the ingestion. Values can be Topology and StatusMessage.

columns.name: TimeProcessed
columns.description: Time(in UTC) at which the traffic analytics discovered the topology resource.

columns.name: TopologyVersion
columns.description: Topology version.

columns.name: SchemaVersion
columns.description: This is topology schema version and not related to flow log schema version.

columns.name: MacAddress
columns.description: MAC address of the discovered NIC.

columns.name: Name
columns.description: Name of the discovered resource.

columns.name: Region
columns.description: Region of the discovered resource.

columns.name: AzureResourceType
columns.description: Resource type of the discovered resource.

columns.name: Subscription
columns.description: Subscription guid of the discovered resource.

columns.name: SubscriptionName
columns.description: Subscription name of the discovered resource.

columns.name: DiscoveryRegion
columns.description: The region where resource is discovered.

columns.name: Tags
columns.description: Tags associated with the discovered resource.

columns.name: AddressPrefixes
columns.description: The address prefixes associated with the discovered resource.

columns.name: Nsg
columns.description: The reference to the network security group resource.

columns.name: RouteTable
columns.description: The reference to the route table resource.

columns.name: GatewayType
columns.description: Gateway Type assocaited with virtual network gateway, VPN or express route.

columns.name: VirtualSubnetwork
columns.description: Virtual subnetwork associated with virtual network gateway.

columns.name: VipAddress
columns.description: Space separated list of IP addresses associated with virtual network gateway.

columns.name: Sku
columns.description: SKU or pricing associated with the discovered resource.

columns.name: BgpEnabled
columns.description: Whether BGP is enabled for this resource or not.

columns.name: VpnClientAddressPrefixes
columns.description: The reference to the address prefix resource which represents address prefix for P2S VpnClient. Will be empty when no point to site is configured.

columns.name: IpAddress
columns.description: Gateway IP address of the discovered resource.

columns.name: SubnetPrefixes
columns.description: Space separated string of address prefixes in local network address space.

columns.name: IsVirtualAppliance
columns.description: Boolean to specify if the discovered resource is a virtual appliance.

columns.name: VmssName
columns.description: The virtual machine scale set name.

columns.name: Zones
columns.description: The virtual machine zones information.

columns.name: Priority
columns.description: Specifies the priority for the virtual machine. Minimum api-version: 2019-03-01.

columns.name: VirtualMachine
columns.description: The reference to a virtual machine.

columns.name: PrivateIpAddresses
columns.description: Private IP address of the IP configuration.

columns.name: PublicIpAddresses
columns.description: Public IP address bound to the IP configuration.

columns.name: Subnetwork
columns.description: The refrence to the subnetwork resource.

columns.name: EnableIpForwarding
columns.description: Indicates whether IP forwarding is enabled on the network interface.

columns.name: LoadBalancerBackendPools
columns.description: Pool of load balancer backend IP addresses.

columns.name: ApplicationGatewayBackendPools
columns.description: Pool of application gateway backend IP addresses.

columns.name: IsFlowEnabled
columns.description: Flag to enable/disable flow logging.

columns.name: FlowLogStorageAccount
columns.description: Id of the storage account which is used to store the flow log.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Description of with network security group rule.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: Protocol associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: SourcePortRange
columns.description: Source port range associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: DestinationPortRange
columns.description: Destination port range associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: SourceAddressPrefix
columns.description: Source address prefix associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: DestinationAddressPrefix
columns.description: Destination address prefix associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: Access
columns.description: Access(Allow/Deny) associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: Direction
columns.description: Direction associated with network security group rule.

columns.name: RuleType
columns.description: The type of the network security group rule.

columns.name: NextHopType
columns.description: The type of azure hop the packet should be sent to.

columns.name: NextHopIp
columns.description: The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is virtual appliance.

columns.name: VirtualNetworkGateway1
columns.description: The reference to virtual network gateway resource.

columns.name: VirtualNetworkGateway2
columns.description: The reference to virtual network gateway resource.

columns.name: LocalNetworkGateway
columns.description: The reference to local network gateway resource.

columns.name: Peer
columns.description: The reference to peerings resource.

columns.name: GatewayConnectionType
columns.description: Gateway connection type.

columns.name: ConnectionType
columns.description: Connection type of the discovered connection.

columns.name: ConnectionStatus
columns.description: Gateway connection status.

columns.name: RoutingWeight
columns.description: The routing weight.

columns.name: IngressBytesTransferred
columns.description: The ingress bytes transferred in this connection.

columns.name: EgressBytesTransferred
columns.description: The egress bytes transferred in this connection.

columns.name: VirtualNetwork1
columns.description: The reference to the virtual network resource associated with the virtual network peering.

columns.name: VirtualNetwork2
columns.description: The reference to the virtual network resource associated with the virtual network peering.

columns.name: AllowVirtualNetworkAccess
columns.description: Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space.

columns.name: AllowForwardedTraffic
columns.description: Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network.

columns.name: AllowGatewayTransit
columns.description: If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network.

columns.name: UseRemoteGateways
columns.description: If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway.

columns.name: LoadBalancerType
columns.description: The type of the discovered load balancer resource. Possible values are internal load balancer or internet facing load balancer.

columns.name: FrontendSubnet
columns.description: The subnet of the discovered load balancer resource. This will be populated when the load balancer is internal load balancer.

columns.name: FrontendSubnets
columns.description: List of space separated subnets of the discovered load balancer resource. This will be populated when the load balancer is internal load balancer.

columns.name: FrontendIps
columns.description: Frontend IP address of the load balancer.

columns.name: BackendSubnets
columns.description: List of space separated subnets associated with the discovered resource.

columns.name: AppGatewayType
columns.description: Type of the application gateway resource. This would be either internal or internet facing.

columns.name: PrivateFrontendIps
columns.description: Front end private IP addresses associated with the application gateway resource.

columns.name: PublicFrontendIps
columns.description: Front end public IP addresses associated with the application gateway resource.

columns.name: GatewaySubnet
columns.description: Subnet associated with the application aateway resource.

columns.name: VirtualAppliances
columns.description: Virtual appliances associated with the discovered subnetwork connection.

columns.name: Subnet1
columns.description: Subnet associated with the discovered subnetwork connection.

columns.name: Subnet2
columns.description: Subnet associated with the discovered subnetwork connection.

columns.name: SubnetRegion1
columns.description: Subnet region associated with the discovered subnetwork connection.

columns.name: SubnetRegion2
columns.description: Subnet region associated with the discovered subnetwork connection.

columns.name: FrontendIpAddress
columns.description: Frontend IP address associated with the inbound NAT rule.

columns.name: BackendIpAddress
columns.description: Backend IP address associated with the inbound NAT rules.

columns.name: FrontendPort
columns.description: Frontend port associated with the inbound NAT rules. The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65534.

columns.name: BackendPort
columns.description: Backend port associated with the inbound NAT rules. The port used for the internal endpoint. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65535.

columns.name: FloatingIpEnabled
columns.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

columns.name: BackendAddressPool
columns.description: The reference to backend address pool resource.

columns.name: CircuitProvisioningState
columns.description: The current provisioning state of express route circuit.

columns.name: ServiceProviderProperties
columns.description: "Contains service provider properties in an express route circuit. Service provider properties semicolon seperated "ServiceProviderName;ServiceProviderBandwidthInMbps;ServiceProviderPeeringLocation"".

columns.name: ServiceProviderProvisioningState
columns.description: The service provider provisioning state state of the resource.

columns.name: SkuDetail
columns.description: "The SKU of express route circuit. Express route circuit SKU detail semicolon seperated "Family;Name;Tier"".

columns.name: AzureAsn
columns.description: The Azure ASN of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: PeerAsn
columns.description: The peer ASN of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: PeeringType
columns.description: The peering type of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: PrimaryAzurePort
columns.description: The primary port of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: PrimaryPeerAddressPrefix
columns.description: The primary peer address prefix of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: SecondaryAzurePort
columns.description: The secondary port of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: SecondaryPeerAddressPrefix
columns.description: The secondary peer address prefix of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: State
columns.description: The peering state of express route circuit peering.

columns.name: PrimaryBytesIn
columns.description: The primary bytes in of the peering.

columns.name: PrimaryBytesOut
columns.description: The primary bytes out of the peering.

columns.name: SecondaryBytesIn
columns.description: The secondary bytes in of the peering.

columns.name: SecondaryBytesOut
columns.description: The secondary bytes out of the peering.

columns.name: VlanId
columns.description: The VLAN Id of the peering.

columns.name: Network
columns.description: IP address of a network entity associated with the express route circuit route.

columns.name: PrimaryNextHop
columns.description: Primary next hop address of the express route circuit route.

columns.name: SecondaryNextHop
columns.description: Secondary next hop address of the express route circuit route.

columns.name: LocalPreference
columns.description: Local preference value as set with the set local-preference route-map configuration command of the express route circuit route.

columns.name: Path
columns.description: Autonomous system paths to the destination network of the express route circuit route.

columns.name: Weight
columns.description: Route weight of the express route circuit route.

columns.name: ComponentType
columns.description: Component type of the status message. Possible values are Flowlog/Topology.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Status of the ingestion. Possible values can be Completed/Partial/Failed.

columns.name: VnetEncryptionSupported
columns.description: Indicates whether the virtual machine this nic is attached to supports encryption.

columns.name: EncryptionEnabled
columns.description: Indicates whether encryption is enabled on the virtual network.

columns.name: EncryptionEnforcement
columns.description: Indicates whether the encrypted virtual network allows VM that does not support encryption. Possible values include DropUnencrypted/AllowUnencrypted.

columns.name: PrivateEndpointResourceId
columns.description: Resource ID of the private endpoint resource.

columns.name: PrivateLinkResourceId
columns.description: Resource ID of the private link service.

tables.name: NTAIpDetails
tables.description: Traffic Analytics provides WHOIS data and geographic location for all public IPs in the customer's environment. For Malicious IP, it provides DNS domain, threat type and thread descriptions as identified by Microsoft security intelligence solutions. IP Details are published to your Log Analytics Workspace so you can create custom queries and put alerts on them. You can also access pre-populated queries from the traffic analytics dashboard.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the data gets ingested into the Log Analytics Workspace.

columns.name: SubType
columns.description: Subtype for the flow logs. Use only FlowLog, other values of SubType_s are for internal workings of the product.

columns.name: FaSchemaVersion
columns.description: Schema version.

columns.name: FlowIntervalStartTime
columns.description: Start time of the flow log processing interval. This is time from which flow interval is measured.

columns.name: FlowIntervalEndTime
columns.description: End time of the flow log processing interval.

columns.name: FlowType
columns.description: Can be AzurePublic/ExternalPublic/MaliciousFlow.

columns.name: Ip
columns.description: Public IP whose information is provided in the record.

columns.name: PublicIpDetails
columns.description: For AzurePublic IP: Azure Service owning the IP OR "Microsoft Virtual Public IP" for IP 168.63.129.16 . ExternalPublic/Malicious IP: WhoIS information of the IP.

columns.name: ThreatType
columns.description: For Malicious IPs only: One of the threats from the list of currently allowed values.

columns.name: DnsDomain
columns.description: For Malicious IPs only: Domain name associated with this IP.

columns.name: ThreatDescription
columns.description: For Malicious IPs only: Description of the threat posed by the malicious IP.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: For Azure Public IP: Azure region of virtual network/network interface/virtual machine to which the IP belongs OR Global for IP 168.63.129.16. For External Public IP and Malicious IP: 2-letter country code where IP is located (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

columns.name: Url
columns.description: For Malicious IPs only: Url associated with this IP.

columns.name: Port
columns.description: For Malicious IPs only: Port associated with this IP.

tables.name: NTAInsights
tables.description: Traffic Analytics insights are provided for flow data which shows anomalies in data pattern.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the data gets ingested into the Log Analytics Workspace.

columns.name: SubType
columns.description: Subtype for the insights logs.

columns.name: SchemaVersion
columns.description: Schema version.

columns.name: AggregationType
columns.description: Type of data aggregation - 1 for short aggregation and 2 for long aggregation.

columns.name: IntervalStart
columns.description: Start time of the data insights processing interval.

columns.name: IntervalEnd
columns.description: End time of the data insights processing interval.

columns.name: PivotType
columns.description: Pivot type for insights aggregation.

columns.name: InsightsResourceId
columns.description: Resource ID for the resource for which data is aggregated

columns.name: Region
columns.description: Region of Vnet flow logs.

columns.name: DataPoints
columns.description: Data points for aggregated data.

columns.name: TrafficVolumeUnit
columns.description: The aggregated values represent Flows/Bytes/Packets.

columns.name: FlowStatus
columns.description: The considered traffic is Allowed/Denied/All.

columns.name: SeriesNumber
columns.description: An incremental value to represent the last aggregated series.

columns.name: ProcessingTime
columns.description: The time when periodicty is calculated.

columns.name: Periodicity
columns.description: The number of hours after whichthe data repeats itself.

columns.name: TrafficVolumeActual
columns.description: The actual traffic volume in the time period.

columns.name: TrafficVolumeBaseline
columns.description: The predicted value of the series, according to the decomposition per the anomaly calculation algorithm.

columns.name: TrafficTime
columns.description: Time when the anomaly has occured in data pattern.

columns.name: AdFlag
columns.description: A ternary series containing (+1, -1, 0) marking up/down/no anomaly respectively.

columns.name: AdScore
columns.description: Anomaly score.
